response: narrative=Irene Morris, an 83-year-old retired engineering professional, was last seen leaving her home on Hyndford Street, Dundee. Reports suggest that she intended to visit her grandmother, Clare Wood, who resides in an assisted living facility. Family members confirm that Irene took the usual route past Fort Street and the nearby train station to reach her destination, but never arrived. Speculation arose that she might have diverted to an alleyway near these locations, possibly becoming disoriented due to a mild cognitive impairment. She was ultimately traced by her family two days later at a physical therapy clinic on Kirsty Semple Way.

narrative=Irene Morris, who had been in touch with an unknown online group, was reported missing after failing to return from an outdoor festival in Dundee. A concerned friend alerted her grandfather, Karl Gregory, who began searching local areas. Irene was last seen near the train station at 1 Pitfour Street, Dundee. Police ultimately traced her to 484 Perth Road, where she was found safe.

narrative=Irene Morris, an 84-year-old woman with a disability, was last seen leaving her nursing home on Fort Street, Dundee. She had frequently spoken of visiting her grandmother, Clare Wood, who resided near East School Road, Dundee. Despite mobility challenges, Irene's determination often led her to wander. A neighbor on 146 Pitkerro Road reported seeing her walking with purpose, though looking disoriented, suggesting she might have been heading towards 22 Marine Parade Walk, known to have been a favored spot. Concern grew as hours passed without contact. She was finally traced by police to a residence on Ancrum Road, unharmed but confused about her surroundings.
